{"step_by_step_thinking": "Odontoblasts are the cells responsible for the formation of dentin in teeth. According to Document [3], odontoblasts derive from ectomesenchymal cells originated by migration of neural crest cells during the early craniofacial development. Ectomesenchyme is a type of mesenchyme, which is a form of undifferentiated connective tissue. Therefore, odontoblasts are derived from undifferentiated mesenchymal cells.", "answer_choice": "A"}
